modelConfiguration.description: A model configuration is the set of values of the parameters and initial values of the state variables of the model at the start of a given scenario, usually at timestep zero or one (depending on the choice of the start index).

modelId.description: The ID of the AMR model.

name.description: A very concise name describing the scenario for which this configuration represents; for example, 'Onset of an outbreak in the United States'.

description.description: A description of the scenario represented by the given model configuration; usually no more than one or two sentences.

extractionPage.description: The page number where the model configuration was found in the text.

inferredParameterList.description: A list of probability distributions for every parameter defined in the model.

distribution.description: probability distribution for a parameter of the model at the start of the scenario; it can be posterior probability distributions derived from data using, for example, Bayesian statistics or maximum likelihood estimation.

value.description: The initial value of the given parameter; it can be a point estimate or median of the probability distribution; it must be a real number.

minimum.description: The lower bound of the probability distribution; it must be a real number.

maximum.description: The upper bound of the probability distribution; it must be a real number.

referenceId.description: The ID used to reference the parameter in the AMR model.

source.description: A citation or description of the reference resource in which the value of this model parameter is defined.

initialSemanticList.description: A list of initial values for every state defined in the model.

items.description: The initial condition of a given state variable of the model; a starting value (number or mathematical expression) of this state variable; usually at timestep zero or one (depending on the choice of the starting index).

expression.description: A mathematical representation of the initial condition of this state variable, written in SymPy; for example, the initial condition of the state variable 'proportion of infected individuals' can be a percentage of the total population.

expressionMathml.description: A MathML equivalent of the Sympy expression for the initial condition of this state variable.

source.description: A citation or description of the reference resource in which the initial condition of this state variable is defined.

target.description: Target should be the ID of the initial state variable in the AMR model.

observableSemanticList.description: A list of values for for every observable defined in the model.

items.description: An observable is a real-valued function of the parameters and state variables of the model; it usually represents a measurable property that can be derived from the state of the model; examples include the total population of individuals (sum of all the state variables in a compartmental model) and the basic reproduction number (a ratio of the transmission rate and the recovery rate).

expression.description: A mathematical representation of the observable function, written in SymPy.

expressionMathml.description: A MathML equivalent of the Sympy expression for the observable.

referenceId.description: The ID of the observable in the AMR model.

source.description: A citation or description of the reference resource in which the observable is defined.

states.description: A list of states that are used in the observable function.

items.description: The ID of the state variable in the AMR model.

parameterSemanticList.description: A list of values for for every parameter defined in the model.

items.description: The initial value of a given parameter of the model; it can be a probability distribution representing measurement uncertainty or a real number (a point estimate).

distribution.description: A constant value or probability distribution representing the measurement uncertainty or best range estimate of the model parameter.

value.description: The constant value of the parameter, or the initial value of the probability distribution; it must be a real number.

minimum.description: The lower bound parameter of the probability distribution; it must be a real number.

maximum.description: The upper bound parameter of the probability distribution; it must be a real number.

type.description: The type of value for the parameter. can be a constant value or a distribution

referenceId.description: The ID used to reference the parameter in the model AMR.

source.description: A citation or description of the reference resource in which the value of this model parameter is defined.
